segment.source: The App-V Desktop Client can be configured to allow connection to a network regardless of whether the client is domain joined or non-domain joined.
segment.target: The App-V Desktop Client can be configured to allow connection to a network regardless of whether the client is domain joined or non-domain joined.

segment.source: Clients that are domain joined, but outside the internal network, can communicate with the App-V infrastructure by using a VPN connection.
segment.target: Clients that are domain joined, but outside the internal network, can communicate with the App-V infrastructure by using a VPN connection.

segment.source: When you want to provide users the ability to leave the internal network but still communicate in an App-V infrastructure, your environment requires very little setup.
segment.target: When you want to provide users the ability to leave the internal network but still communicate in an App-V infrastructure, your environment requires very little setup.

segment.source: Because the users are already part of the domain, you simply need to ensure that Cached Credentials are supported on the client.
segment.target: Because the users are already part of the domain, you simply need to ensure that Cached Credentials are supported on the client.

segment.source: This is the default configuration, and any changes to this setting can be accomplished from Group Policies.
segment.target: This is the default configuration, and any changes to this setting can be accomplished from Group Policies.

segment.source: As mentioned in the App-V Security Best Practices Guide, the user will attempt to send their user ticket to the App-V infrastructure for authentication.
segment.target: As mentioned in the App-V Security Best Practices Guide, the user will attempt to send their user ticket to the App-V infrastructure for authentication.

segment.source: If the ticket is expired, it will revert to using NTLM and the cached credentials on the computer.
segment.target: If the ticket is expired, it will revert to using NTLM and the cached credentials on the computer.

segment.source: To allow roaming, administrators must ensure that the publishing server being accessed internally is available at the same name externally for the names to resolve properly.
segment.target: To allow roaming, administrators must ensure that the publishing server being accessed internally is available at the same name externally for the names to resolve properly.

segment.source: Clients that are non-domain joined but need to communicate in the App-V infrastructure must be configured to ensure that authentication to the App-V infrastructure is successful.
segment.target: Clients that are non-domain joined but need to communicate in the App-V infrastructure must be configured to ensure that authentication to the App-V infrastructure is successful.

segment.source: The App-V Desktop Client does not permit prompting for the publishing refresh process, so the client must be configured to present the proper credentials to the App-V Management Server.
segment.target: The App-V Desktop Client does not permit prompting for the publishing refresh process, so the client must be configured to present the proper credentials to the App-V Management Server.

segment.source: The publishing server, which is configured for publishing refresh from the non-domain joined client, requires that the external name that clients access is configured as the common name or a subject alternate name (SAN) on the publishing server’s certificate.
segment.target: The publishing server, which is configured for publishing refresh from the non-domain joined client, requires that the external name that clients access is configured as the common name or a subject alternate name (SAN) on the publishing server’s certificate.

segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows Vista

segment.source: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP
segment.target: How to Assign the Proper Credentials for Windows XP
